website_summaries.verdict: A good general-purpose fluid bottle that helps to keep leaks plugged and stopped for long periods of time.
pros: Lacks the common types of solvents and ingredients that can cause long term damage to a car’s power steering system
Can be used on a variety of car components other than the steering system as well
cons: Leak stoppage properties of the fluid will require reapplication after a certain period of time

customer_reviews.title: Don't replace fluid, add this as necessary

customer_reviews.title: Stopped my leaks
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2001 Toyota Solara and it was leaking power steering fluid from a number of different places in the system and the steering rack. I used a baster and pulled out the old PS fluid and added the Lucas stop leak. Kept an eye on the leaking for 2 weeks, it appeared to be slowing down. I used the baster again and pulled out some more PS fluid from the reservoir and topped it off with Lucas stop leak. At this point I had added about 1 and 1/2 12 oz. bottles of Lucas. Not long after this the leaks stopped. I haven't had to add any additional fluid since May. So far so good! Would recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't stop leak, but did smooth out the steering
customer_reviews.text: First let me say the rack on my 01 CRV and 03 Pilot both leak. So, facing over $1.5k in repairs, I thought I would give Lucas PS Stop Leak a shot. Did this product stop the leaks? No. Did it slow them down? A little. But, I will admit that it smoothed out the steering and that was noticeable. On both cars. Let's be honest, if you rack is leaking, it's probably because of the seals and this product isn't going to save you from an expensive rack replacement. It might buy you some time. So 3 stars because I was foolish enough to think this would actually fix a leaking rack, but it's not a bad product.
